author: Staff Reporter
text:
A Sessions Court here on Thursday ordered appearance of Jayendra Saraswathi, head of Kanchi Kamakoti Mutt, and 10 others in connection with an attempt to murder case registered over a decade ago.

The prosecution’s case is that Radhakrishnan, a former associate of Kanchi Mutt in Kancheepuram, was attacked with deadly weapons on September 20, 2002 in which he and his wife were seriously injured.

Later, the Foreshore Estate police registered a case against the seer and 11 others in connection with the attack.

Subsequently, Jayendra Saraswathi, Sundresa Iyer, Ragu, Ravisubramaniam, Appu, Kathiravan and six others were arrested.

Accused turned hostile

One among the accused, Ravisubramaniam, turned hostile and Appu, and Kathiravan died during the pendency of the trial.

55 witnesses

So far, the prosecution has produced 55 witnesses and 220 documentary evidences against the accused. When the case came up for hearing on Thursday before the I Additional Sessions Court, Chennai, Judge Rajamanikam directed all the accused to appear before the court on March 28 for framing of charges.
title: Court summons Kanchi seer in attempt to murder case
